slides.title: This is geo-engineering in Wikipedia
slides.text:
As you can see, it is not very legible.
No major authorities or clusters are discernible.

slides.title: But if we add (manual) categorisation...
slides.text:
... the graph becomes more readable
and an interesting polarisation appears.

slides.title: The 3 main poles of geo-engineering in Wikipedia
slides.text:
The shape of the network of Wikipedia pages is stretched by three main thematic poles:
- core geo-engineering (red)
- forestry-related technologies (violet)
- ocean-related technologies (green)

slides.title: Clusterisation is hidden by scientific pages
slides.text: A large number of pages generally related to scientific topic are situated in the centre of the network and impede the separation of clusters

slides.title: ... and of course there are exception
slides.text: "Ocean fertilisation" and "Upwelling" are located 'naturally' in the ocean pole

slides.title: Advocacy is also highly focused
slides.text: As a conclusion, it is interesting to note that the pages of the people that advocate most strongly for geo-engineering are concentrated around the "core geo-engineering pole"

slides.title: Now feel free to explore by yourself
slides.text: A large number of pages generally related to scientific topic are situated in the centre of the network and impede the separation of clusters
